xYmu2mpP4m0v6MhD9C1fBg.text: Located in the food hall under Raffles City, we stopped here for ramen lunch amidst our hot travels around Bugis/City Hall.This ramen spot is definitely a little close in quarters, as you can basically hear what the table next to you is saying--and there's never enough room for the servers to squeeze by the other tables to get to yours...so we had to tell our server our orders across the other table. Awkward to say the least, but everybody seemed very chill about it.They also do drinks, and had some alcoholic happy hour of sorts...which I thought was a little out of place. It's a ramen spot, soooo where's the sake and beer? The ramen itself was delicious and perfect in portion size. We had the miso and shiro ramen, and I loved their noodles. So chewy/QQ and the right consistency in broth, but a bit on the richer side.I'd definitely recommend Daikokuya ramen, and when we were walking around that day...other lunch spots didn't really jump out at us. The pricing is around $11+ for a bowl of ramen, which is on the average scale. Service was quick, but no fuss. They don't provide napkins, so it's good to bring your own. Otherwise, the AC is nonexistent so try not to stick to your chairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Daikokuya - Singapore, Singapore. You can have varied noodle texture and broth density!

aizR0PzlEFbTaOjggPCo3w.text: Salmon mini rice bowl - 4 starsI'd get this again! Simple and well-cooked - the salmon wasn't dry, and the salmon eggs on top were delicious. I ordered this as part of a friend's set that came with the mini rice bowl, ramen, and a salad. The salad was unimpressive - iceberg lettuce with tomatoes and dressing thrown on. Wouldn't order it on its own but the other salads on the menu might be better.

X9QMCTZcNqShRXSY3ICY2Q.text: Good Japanese Ramen noodle soups, great Gyoza and cold beer. I sampled several of the places in this restaurant/mall, this was my favorite. Quick and happy service as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Daikokuya - Singapore, Singapore. Tonkotsu Cha Shu Ramen

Hb5lAx_Bf4nqzh7Vd993Iw.text: The ramen here always hits the spot - chewy and tasty with a fragrant broth, and not the oiliest of the ramen's that I've tried. Having side dishes and curry rice options are also a good idea so friends who don't really like ramen have more options to choose from as well.  I really like how they have a 'mini' option (smaller sizes - that are usually around 2/3 of the price of the standard bowl of ramen) as I'm a grazer and don't like big meals - combined with the fact that I have a really sweet tooth, it always leaves me room for an after dinner snack and dessert.  The raffles city outlet really annoyed me the last time I went with their choice of music though - coupled with it being blasted over the speakers, it was hard to think of anything else besides the Vengaboys' Shalala Lala song that played TWICE in my short 25 mins there.  I'm not sure if I'm alone here but I don't really like teenage pop music blasting over the speakers over dinner.  If the management considered changing the choice of music that would be a huge plus.  Didn't encounter this as the Paragon outlet.

gl5zPCtHsNP1UHCMN4_NwA.text: Average at best - 2.5 stars? Noodles were not al dente, broth was heavy without being thoroughly flavorful... saving grace for me was that the eggs were done well. Prefer Menya if I was to eat at Raffles City... otherwise, there are so many other places out there!

DfP5iof2500t5G1tR6M9Eg.text: A good broth is the most important factor in a solid bowl of ramen. I had the miso ramen and the broth was diluted and disappointing. The ramen noodles were too thick for my liking too. The saving grace of the ramen was the pork which was just about tasty enough to warrant the price of dinner.With so many superb ramen joints around Singapore and even one just on level one of City Hall, I think there is almost no reason for me to visit this eatery again.

ZTKitdpf4huDQ3YxQCbiAQ.text: Ordered Daikokuya Maze Ramen. The noodle is done al dente, which is quite rare in normal ramen place. It's thicker than ramen, close to udon, and very chewy, this is very essential for any noodle.Haven't try other ramen yet, but this one is worthy trying.

LDHVA2mkcovCYrJrBG7Jqg.text: Not as good as Ippudo but still good ramen with lots of flavors. Seats are limited and they are so close to each other. A food way to pick up girls. Just kidding

XEH2vUOtK-Rq8GddR9sHog.text: Soup was nothing to rave about. Noodles were soggy and limp. Waitresses were nightmares. Ebi and Avocado Salad was average at best.
